etymologies: late 16th century (in the rare sense ‘knowledge of the nature of human beings’): from anthropo- + Greek sophia ‘wisdom’; the modern use dates from the early 20th century

definitions: a formal educational, therapeutic, and creative system established by Rudolf Steiner, seeking to use mainly natural means to optimize physical and mental health and well-being.
shortDefinitions: formal educational, therapeutic, and creative system established by Rudolf Steiner, seeking to use
